description: Numbers n such that n^2 is a concatenation of two nonzero squares.
comments: Leading zeros not allowed, trailing zeros are.This means that, e.g., 95 is not in the sequence although 95^2 = 9025 could be seen as concatenation of 9 and 025 = 5^2. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 25 2016
mathematica: ok[n_] := (id = IntegerDigits[n^2]; r = False; Do[n1 = Take[id, k]; n2 = Drop[id, k]; If[IntegerQ[ Sqrt[ FromDigits[n1]]] && IntegerQ[ Sqrt[ FromDigits[n2]]] && First[n2] != 0, r = True; Break[]], {k, 1, Length[id]-1}]; r); Select[Range[3000], ok] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Oct 20 2011 *)
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Mar 15 1999.
